column4: I have a 3ghz amd64 and my dad wouldn't let me install windows xp 64 bit eddition. Since I am using vmware, I am not sure if I can run a 64 bit guest os, in a 32 bit host os

How to install an ati card, 1. Mount it on a wooden post in the yard. 2. Load shotgun, 3. FIre at will. 4. Buy an nvidia
Ill have to try it later when I actually have spare time to play around with it
current releases of VMware allow you to run 64bit operating systems on 32 and 64bit machines
performance wouldn't be all that great doing a 64bit O/S on a 32bit CPU, though .. performance is great in the other direction though
My machine is 64 bit, but the host os, namely windows xp is 32 bit
I have an amd64, but it runs 32 bit windows
ah, I see .. and you want to try out a 64bit GNU/Linux distro on top of that 32bit Windows ?
yup, thats the idea. I was told it wasn't a good idea though
that will work, but it will be running the 64bit emulation from your CPU's 32bit emulation, as your Windows kernel doesn't support 64bit
that is just not worth the trouble, triple-layer emulation is a performance nightmare

it may not be as bad as you think, being that AMD is quite good at emulating the 32bit CPU (almost 2x32bit CPUs for each 64bit one), but you will then have VMware's 64bit emulation to contend with. all in all, you will lose performance over just running a 32bit GNU/Linux distro
you're much better off installing a 64bit GNU/Linux and then emulating the Win32 from that base
What about duel booting 64 bit linux with 32bit windows
you should have no problems dual-booting, if you don't mind actually having to reboot
